title: if urgot is viewed as weak he should get usability buffs first
body:
things that make him smoother to play like removing Q cast lockout while purge is active, removing the self-stun after landing his E, things like that 

his damage numbers are completely fine and I think his 'clunky' things are what holds him back, or what makes him SEEM weak to the average player. IF he is seen as weak later then you should tinker with this first

replies.body:
He's _currently_ scheduled for a few tweaks next patch:

* If you enter W with a target locked on, they'll stay locked on for the whole W.
* E cast lockout following missed is being reduced by ~0.35 or something.
* R duration 3 >>> 4

Do you think it's worth consider adding a more transparent visual indicator for when an enemy is below 25% & for the timer for the ult when it's impaled into the enemy? When I'm in lane by myself, it's pretty easy to see the indicator for the execute, but the timer for the ult is so hard to see when it's at the enemy's feet. It's not as clear as say a Braum passive proc because it's a very thin transparent circle that's usually covered by minions or terrain during laning or teamfights. In teamfights, the execute indicator is somewhat hard to see as well, but it's not too bad. 

A huge improvement into making those ult opportunities more transparent could be having a permanent marker over the enemy's healthbar at the 25% mark to gauge potential trades (which might be too generous) or a mark _**over**_ the enemy when they fall below 25% (something like 5-mark Darius passive or Garen villian mark). Having an overheard mark for the ult timer CD would be great as well, as it would be much more transparent to my teammates to try to finish the impaled enemy off. So many moments where if my team simply switched targets when I ulted someone, we would have instantly gotten a pick. But then again, I don't know the Riot team philosophy on making those elements visually transparent for executes (like Cho ult, Jhin shots), if at all. 

TLDR; I love the Urgot rework because he has very clear strengths and weaknesses, with amazing high-points in his gameplay, but the ULT could be more visually transparent for both the player and teammates.
Yeah, I believe at one point we were planning to have a notch in the health bar for 25%, but it didn't quite make it in. Hopefully in the future though :)

Can u probably consider disabling shotgun knees from firing on basic attacks to minions? Urgot feels so useless without his shotgun knees being up and, furthermore, u dont always wanna push the wave (u wanna freeze near ur turret instead). Knees will still fire on minions during W. It's a very important QoL change and, together with Q's slow explosion time, is what actually holds him back from being a viable pick. Still I dont value his slow Q explosion as so important.

The problem with this is that it gives no counter play to the lane opponent. Good Urgot players are able to only use on shotgun knee and farm within that cone, so I would recommend picking that ability up. Plus having the knees proc on minions gives Urgot players the ability to push faster/harass the lane opponent. I would not want to waste mana to push a wave use to use the shotgun knees on minions.
Urgot doesnt offer much to a team anyway. Why should he not have a good laning phase at least? His abilities have so much counterplay, his passive shouldnt though.

Considering pressing the R again while the impaled target is not below 25% just primes the suppress for as soon as they DO fall below it, it would be nice to have a mark over impaled targets for allies, but just have Urgot instantly fire the suppression the moment they fall below 25%.

This would remove a little control, but it shouldn't ever realistically be a feel-bad scenario for Urgot, and it removes the need to press R a second time after it connects the first time, and wondering if they did or didn't actually cross the threshold or what happened exactly.

I really don't think a notch in the healthbar would be needed, or any other kind of indicator they're below 25%, since it's a consistent portion of the healthbar (unlike Cho/Garen executes, and Darius doesn't get it because it would remove skill expression).  But if a mark or notch were going to be put in, it should be much lower priority next to the first two changes I mentioned, I think.

Thoughts?

Please reconsider the notch in the health bar again. I have been playing a ton of Urgot and it has been bugging me since his launch. This is the exact thing I keep telling my friends they should add for Urgot. It would feel a whole lot better. I usually do not ever use the league board but for this change I just NEEDED to take the opportunity to speak out my feedback to you.

Have you played the old Urgot in the times before his rework? He would get outscaled by basically every other ranged champion in the game. If he missed his E, he would then proceed to get blasted by any champ with decent range. Even if he did get a lock-on, he would have less damage even with his E+Q by autos from a similarly farmed ADC. His matchups top are not bad early, but against smarter enemies they would simply just wait for ganks or their scaling and then engage & out-damage you at melee range. He was also HEAVILY gated by being forced to build Tear, yet not having damage to compensate, so his mid-game scaling was horrendous. 

New Urgot's main damage comes from his shotgun knees. The Q is simply the method for you to slow and land an E onto enemies. The W is then used not for the damage, but to quickly rapid-fire you shotgun shells. You still dominate melee matchups. But it's not just "Land an E and spam Q." You play around your Q range and wait for the enemy to slip and fall in range for the E. They fall too low in health and you scare them with your ult. And it's amazing as hell to land that.

Get Mana runes instead of getting the tear. Miss your E? Keep hitting Q, you should of killed them by  like 3 of those. Outscale? Get runes that scale for attack damage. Mostly helps.
New Urgot's damage is from passive now instead of his old Q. There's a delay in his ult and can be avoided, also by a tryndamere R or I believe Guardian angel cancels it too. Ult is mainly useful for tanks, not so much squishy champs.

Exactly! People want his q to be buffed because they think it's designed to poke the enemy down in lane. It's really just a set up for his e. If he had the ability to consistently poke from far range in lane, combined with the shield and burst initiation from his w, e and passive procs, he'd be busted.

Thank you Riot Repertoir I am glad to hear that Urgot is getting some tweak

Please take in consideration:

* Urgot has an hard early game cause he's **too much Item dependant**. 
* The ult windup telegraphing and projectile speed makes it so much easy to dodge and hard to land on really close and long range.
What about taking back the old Acid Hunter's mechanic and make the Drill locking on the "Locked-On" target ala old Acid Hunter?
* Please consider the opportunity to make Urgot's Q like **Vel'koz' W** *[2 casts, then start Cooldown (with rebalancing of damages and slow)]*, that could make it less tedious to wait for the Q to engage and eventually a nice tool to swap focus in teamfights.
* ...

Which champs are you having a hard early game against? He definitely has a few champs he struggles, but against most other he can either farm safely or straight-up win. 

The Ult is an execute ability, it should have some degree of counterplay (which is, uh, dodging). The speed is pretty damn fast along with the hilarious range. It's very much a learning experience  to expect opponents to flash in fear of getting hit and predicting the enemy movement. It's akin to hitting a Lee-Sin Q, but with a greater award (and as such, a much longer cooldown if you miss).

It's clear as the sun, it needs boots for the MS, Health for the Shield, CDR for its long cooldowns, another item for addictional MS, eventually lethality to do decent damage, Sterakks to survive... **It's too much item dependant** and most items active/passive abilities are a "must take" to make it work smoothly, when for example many characters are good on their own and only made better by stats scaling and said items active/passives.

Most platinum+ players have enough experience to totally predict and take advantage of the long delay from Urgot's Ult, which results really often into a wasted opportunity to win the lane or do your job.
I'm totally in favor of counterplay, but this is ridicle.
Also in teamfights, the Delay makes it really hard to land it properly on the target, when people are costantly moving and other 4 meat shields can simply step in the trajectory or dodge away.

That's why I suggested to bring back the old Acid Hunter mechanic, if you successfully lock on a target in a teamfight, you should be still able to lock it with your skills like the old Urgot did.

Didn't mention QSS, dispels or Immunity to CC (Gangplank, Kled, Morgana, Olaf, Sion, Alistar, Kled), Invulnerabilities (Tryndamere, Kayle, Zilean, Guardian Angel), Untargetable phase (Master Yi, Kalista, Kled), Heals, Shields on a 26% Hp target, not having the clearest idea of what 25% hp are on the enemy bar (Lulu also), Shields Mechanics blocking it (Braum, Yasuo), Clones blocking it (Wukong, Shaco)...
There's so much active and passive counterplay that makes it an hell to land and a so much circumstancial spell.

Since the biggest utility Urgot brings is this Ranged Execute, being not able to pull it out makes Urgot a less efficent choice.
I could as well pick a Zed or a random assassin/fighter and do the job with a click-target ability.

I've played it more than 50 games both ranked at Gold/Plat level and normals. My mechanics aren't perfect, I'm not a proplayer, but I think I've enough experience with Urgot's kit to understand its pro and cons with no problems.

as a sion main i had zero issues with urgot's clunky kit

he is very timing & positioning sensitive due to them like sion, it does raise his skillfloor and cap by a large amount, people just are not used to playing champions like that.

For anyone reading this, stop building frozen mallet, it's a bit of a noobtrap, it's not a bad item necessarily but it won't help much either. even with the item walking around your enemy during purge is near impossible unless you land your Q. you need to position yourself properly first before you can move around them even with mallet that is going to be very difficult. And there are better items available.

It's better to have a team that can support urgot in doing maximum damage through hard cc & zoning 


And this is where i see the biggest issue with urgot, he might be too reliable on his team for fully utilizing his damage potential. The problem stems from the fact that he can often only play in 2 positions, jungle & top which also happen to be the positions that you would normally see tanks/fighters with good durability and hard cc. And you kind of want those alongside urgot to help him wade through the enemy team by initiating and locking people down.

Part of playing Urgot successfully though is landing that Q and then landing your E (or otherwise landing just your E if they come into range). Because it's not so much that you literally try to walk around them to get your maximum knee circumference off, but to flip them straight into your back shotguns (which are usually unused in lane), and then proceeding to walk around them from point-blank for the rest of your shotguns. 

I don't think Frozen Mallet is a bad item at all, I think it's actually a much better item to go first item then Black Cleaver. Jaurim's Fist is such an efficient component item on Urgot, and the +250 health on Frozen Mallet vs Cleaver makes you considerably tankier than getting Black Cleaver. Even though you lose out on the CDR, I haven't had situations where I regret not going Cleaver, because the damage I still have with Mallet is enough to still have kill pressure in lane. And the slow is really nice in sticking to your enemies. 

Urgot really benefits from having engage or pick champions on his team, because all he really needs is to get on to the enemy team. An enemy team comp with range and disengage is the worst for Urgot and really limits his power. I would say he's more reliant on the enemy team comp than his own team. He is probably one of the most threatening counter-engage champions in the game, with his E to flip engage away from your backline and his ult as a tank killer.
